Name: Aloevera
Description: A succulent plant species known for its medicinal properties. It is cultivated worldwide for its gel, which is used in various health and beauty products.
Location: Found in tropical climates, commonly grown in gardens and as potted plants indoors.
Medical_Usage: Used for treating skin conditions, burns, wounds, and as a dietary supplement.

Name: Amla
Description: Also known as Indian gooseberry, it is a small tree native to India that produces greenish-yellow fruit renowned for its high vitamin C content.
Location: Native to India and found in tropical and subtropical regions of Asia.
Medical_Usage: Used in traditional Ayurvedic medicine for improving digestion, boosting immunity, and promoting hair growth.

Name: Amruthaballi
Description: Known as Giloy or Guduchi, it is a climbing shrub native to India. It has heart-shaped leaves and is valued for its medicinal properties.
Location: Found in tropical regions, especially in the Indian subcontinent.
Medical_Usage: Used in Ayurveda for its immunomodulatory properties, treating fever, diabetes, and improving digestion.

Name: Arali
Description: A plant known for its large leaves and medicinal uses in traditional medicine.
Location: Found in tropical and subtropical regions, often cultivated in gardens.
Medical_Usage: Used for treating respiratory ailments and as an anti-inflammatory.

Name: Astma_weed
Description: Also known as Euphorbia hirta, it is a small annual herb known for its medicinal properties in treating asthma and other respiratory disorders.
Location: Found in tropical and subtropical regions worldwide, often considered a weed in gardens.
Medical_Usage: Used traditionally for treating asthma, bronchitis, and skin infections.

Name: Badipala
Description: A plant known for its ornamental value and used in traditional medicine for various health benefits.
Location: Found in gardens and cultivated areas in tropical and subtropical regions.
Medical_Usage: Used for treating skin disorders, promoting hair growth, and as a diuretic.

Name: Balloon_Vine
Description: A climbing plant known for its small white flowers and inflated seed pods, found in tropical and subtropical regions.
Location: Commonly found in disturbed areas, gardens, and along roadsides.
Medical_Usage: Used in traditional medicine for its diuretic, antipyretic, and anti-inflammatory properties.

Name: Bamboo
Description: A fast-growing woody plant known for its strength and versatility, used in construction and various crafts.
Location: Native to Asia, found in tropical and temperate regions worldwide.
Medical_Usage: Used in traditional medicine for treating fever, respiratory disorders, and as a source of nutrients.

Name: Beans
Description: A variety of leguminous plants cultivated for their edible seeds and pods.
Location: Grown in gardens, farms, and cultivated areas worldwide.
Medical_Usage: Rich in protein and nutrients, used in diets to promote heart health and manage diabetes.

Name: Betel
Description: A vine belonging to the Piperaceae family, cultivated for its leaves which are chewed with betel nut and lime as a stimulant.
Location: Native to Southeast Asia and cultivated in tropical regions.
Medical_Usage: Used in traditional medicine for its stimulant, carminative, and antiseptic properties.

Name: Bhrami
Description: A creeping herb known for its medicinal properties, used in Ayurvedic medicine to enhance memory and cognitive functions.
Location: Found in damp and marshy areas in tropical regions.
Medical_Usage: Used for improving memory, reducing anxiety, and treating epilepsy and asthma.

Name: Bringaraja
Description: Also known as False Daisy, it is a herbaceous plant valued for its medicinal properties in hair care and traditional medicine.
Location: Native to India and Southeast Asia, cultivated in tropical regions.
Medical_Usage: Used in Ayurvedic medicine for promoting hair growth, treating liver disorders, and as a diuretic.

Name: Caricature
Description: A small tropical tree with edible fruit, known for its medicinal properties in traditional medicine.
Location: Found in tropical and subtropical regions, cultivated for its fruit.
Medical_Usage: Used for treating digestive disorders, promoting heart health, and as a diuretic.

Name: Castor
Description: A fast-growing shrub cultivated for its seeds, which are the source of castor oil used in various industrial and medicinal applications.
Location: Native to Africa and India, cultivated in tropical and subtropical regions worldwide.
Medical_Usage: Used in traditional medicine for its laxative, anti-inflammatory, and antibacterial properties.

Name: Catharanthus
Description: A genus of flowering plants known for their colorful flowers and medicinal properties.
Location: Found in tropical and subtropical regions, cultivated as ornamental and medicinal plants.
Medical_Usage: Used for producing vinblastine and vincristine, chemotherapy drugs for treating cancer.

Name: Chakte
Description: A small tree native to Mexico known for its medicinal uses.
Location: Found in tropical and subtropical regions, cultivated for its wood and medicinal properties.
Medical_Usage: Used in traditional medicine for treating fever, inflammation, and digestive disorders.

Name: Chilly
Description: A spicy fruit from plants belonging to the genus Capsicum, widely used in culinary dishes worldwide.
Location: Cultivated in gardens and farms in tropical and subtropical regions.
Medical_Usage: Used for its capsaicin content, which has analgesic properties and is used in topical creams for pain relief.

Name: Citron lime (herelikai)
Description: A citrus fruit tree known for its distinctive aroma and culinary uses.
Location: Native to Southeast Asia and cultivated in tropical regions worldwide.
Medical_Usage: Used in traditional medicine for its antioxidant properties and to aid digestion.

Name: Coffee
Description: A small evergreen tree cultivated for its beans, which are roasted and brewed to make coffee.
Location: Native to tropical Africa and cultivated in tropical and subtropical regions worldwide.
Medical_Usage: Used as a stimulant, improves mental alertness and physical performance, and contains antioxidants.

Name: Common rue(naagdalli)
Description: A perennial herb known for its blue-green foliage and medicinal properties.
Location: Native to Mediterranean regions and cultivated in gardens worldwide.
Medical_Usage: Used in traditional medicine for treating menstrual disorders, arthritis, and as an insect repellent.

Name: Coriender
Description: Also known as cilantro or Chinese parsley, it is an annual herb cultivated for its leaves and seeds used in culinary dishes.
Location: Native to regions spanning from Southern Europe and North Africa to southwestern Asia.
Medical_Usage: Used in traditional medicine for its digestive, antibacterial, and antioxidant properties.

Name: Curry
Description: A variety of aromatic herbs and spices used to prepare curry dishes, known for their culinary and medicinal properties.
Location: Cultivated in gardens and farms in tropical and subtropical regions worldwide.
Medical_Usage: Used in traditional medicine for its anti-inflammatory, antimicrobial, and digestive benefits.

Name: Doddpathre
Description: A medicinal plant used in Ayurvedic and traditional medicine for its therapeutic properties.
Location: Found in tropical and subtropical regions, often cultivated in gardens.
Medical_Usage: Used for treating respiratory disorders, promoting digestion, and as a natural insect repellent.

Name: Drumstick
Description: A fast-growing tree known for its long, slender pods filled with seeds that are used in culinary dishes and traditional medicine.
Location: Native to India and cultivated in tropical and subtropical regions worldwide.
Medical_Usage: Used for its nutritional value, promoting digestion, and as an anti-inflammatory.

Name: Ekka
Description: A tree with small yellow flowers and oval leaves, known for its medicinal properties in traditional medicine.
Location: Native to tropical and subtropical regions, often found near water bodies.
Medical_Usage: Used for treating skin diseases, fever, and respiratory ailments.

Name: Eucalyptus
Description: A genus of trees known for their aromatic leaves and medicinal properties.
Location: Native to Australia, now cultivated in temperate and subtropical regions worldwide.
Medical_Usage: Used for its antiseptic, expectorant, and decongestant properties in treating respiratory conditions.

Name: Ganigale
Description: A herbaceous plant with aromatic leaves and small white flowers, used in traditional medicine for its medicinal properties.
Location: Native to tropical and subtropical regions, cultivated for its medicinal uses.
Medical_Usage: Used for treating digestive disorders, as an antispasmodic, and for its calming effects.

Name: Ganike
Description: A vine known for its heart-shaped leaves and small white flowers, used in traditional medicine for its medicinal properties.
Location: Found in tropical and subtropical regions, often cultivated as an ornamental plant.
Medical_Usage: Used for treating skin diseases, fever, and respiratory ailments.

Name: Gasagase
Description: A plant known for its small white flowers and seeds, used in culinary dishes and traditional medicine.
Location: Native to South Asia, cultivated in tropical and subtropical regions.
Medical_Usage: Used for its anti-inflammatory properties and as a digestive aid.

Name: Ginger
Description: A flowering plant known for its underground rhizomes used as a spice and in traditional medicine.
Location: Native to Southeast Asia, cultivated in tropical and subtropical regions worldwide.
Medical_Usage: Used for treating nausea, indigestion, inflammation, and as an antioxidant.

Name: Globe Amarnath
Description: An annual herb with pink or purple flowers, cultivated for its edible and medicinal uses.
Location: Native to subtropical regions, commonly grown in gardens and cultivated areas.
Medical_Usage: Used in traditional medicine for treating diarrhea, inflammation, and as an antioxidant.

Name: Guava
Description: A small tree or shrub with edible fruits, known for its nutritional value and medicinal uses.
Location: Native to tropical America, now grown in tropical and subtropical regions worldwide.
Medical_Usage: Used for its high vitamin C content, as an antidiarrheal, and for its wound healing properties.

Name: Henna
Description: A flowering plant known for its dye-producing leaves, used in cosmetic and medicinal applications.
Location: Native to North Africa, West Asia, and South Asia, cultivated in tropical and subtropical regions.
Medical_Usage: Used for dyeing hair, skin, and nails; also used for its cooling and anti-inflammatory properties.

Name: Hibiscus
Description: A genus of flowering plants known for their large, colorful flowers and medicinal properties.
Location: Native to tropical and subtropical regions, cultivated as ornamental plants and for medicinal use.
Medical_Usage: Used for lowering blood pressure, as a diuretic, and for its antioxidant properties.

Name: Honge
Description: A medium-sized tree with bright yellow flowers, known for its medicinal properties in traditional medicine.
Location: Native to tropical regions, commonly found in forests and cultivated areas.
Medical_Usage: Used for treating skin diseases, digestive disorders, and as an anti-inflammatory agent.

Name: Insulin
Description: A climbing vine with yellow flowers, used in traditional medicine for its medicinal properties.
Location: Native to tropical and subtropical regions, often cultivated for its medicinal uses.
Medical_Usage: Used for treating diabetes, skin diseases, and as a diuretic.

Name: Jackfruit
Description: A large tropical tree with edible fruits that are a source of food and medicinal benefits.
Location: Native to South and Southeast Asia, now cultivated in tropical regions worldwide.
Medical_Usage: Used for its nutritional value, as a digestive aid, and for treating skin diseases.

Name: Jasmine
Description: A genus of shrubs and vines known for their fragrant white or yellow flowers, used in perfumery and traditional medicine.
Location: Native to tropical and temperate regions, cultivated for ornamental purposes and medicinal use.
Medical_Usage: Used for treating headaches, insomnia, anxiety, and as a sedative.

Name: Kambajala
Description: A plant with aromatic leaves and small white flowers, used in traditional medicine for its medicinal properties.
Location: Native to tropical and subtropical regions, often found in gardens and cultivated areas.
Medical_Usage: Used for treating digestive disorders, respiratory ailments, and as an anti-inflammatory.

Name: Kasambruga
Description: A small shrub with yellow flowers, known for its medicinal properties in traditional medicine.
Location: Native to tropical and subtropical regions, commonly found in coastal areas.
Medical_Usage: Used for treating skin diseases, fever, and respiratory ailments.

Name: Kohlrabi
Description: A biennial vegetable with a swollen stem that resembles a turnip, used for its edible bulb and leaves.
Location: Native to Europe, now cultivated in temperate and subtropical regions worldwide.
Medical_Usage: Used for its nutritional value, as a diuretic, and for treating digestive disorders.

Name: Lantana
Description: A genus of flowering plants known for their colorful flowers and medicinal uses in traditional medicine.
Location: Native to tropical and subtropical regions, cultivated as ornamental plants and for medicinal purposes.
Medical_Usage: Used for treating skin diseases, respiratory ailments, and as an insect repellent.

Name: Lemon
Description: A small evergreen tree with edible fruits known for their acidic juice used in culinary and medicinal applications.
Location: Native to South Asia, now grown in tropical and subtropical regions worldwide.
Medical_Usage: Used for its high vitamin C content, as a digestive aid, and for its antibacterial properties.

Name: Lemongrass
Description: A tall perennial grass known for its lemony flavor and medicinal properties.
Location: Native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia, now cultivated worldwide.
Medical_Usage: Used for its antimicrobial, anti-inflammatory, and digestive properties.

Name: Malabar_Nut
Description: A shrub with violet flowers and medicinal properties in traditional medicine.
Location: Native to tropical regions, commonly found in forests and cultivated areas.
Medical_Usage: Used for treating respiratory ailments, fever, and as an expectorant.

Name: Malabar_Spinach
Description: A leafy green vegetable with medicinal properties, used in culinary dishes and traditional medicine.
Location: Native to tropical and subtropical regions, cultivated for its edible leaves and medicinal uses.
Medical_Usage: Used for its nutritional value, as an antioxidant, and for treating digestive disorders.

Name: Mango
Description: A tropical fruit tree known for its sweet and juicy fruits, valued for their nutritional and medicinal benefits.
Location: Native to South Asia, now cultivated in tropical and subtropical regions worldwide.
Medical_Usage: Used for its high vitamin C content, as a digestive aid, and for its antioxidant properties.

Name: Marigold
Description: A genus of flowering plants known for their bright orange or yellow flowers and medicinal uses.
Location: Native to North and Central America, now cultivated worldwide for ornamental and medicinal purposes.
Medical_Usage: Used for treating skin conditions, eye inflammation, and as an antiseptic.

Name: Mint
Description: A genus of aromatic herbs known for their culinary uses and medicinal properties.
Location: Native to temperate regions, now grown worldwide in gardens and cultivated areas.
Medical_Usage: Used for digestive disorders, respiratory ailments, and as a flavoring agent.

Name: Neem
Description: A fast-growing evergreen tree known for its bitter leaves and seeds, used in traditional medicine and agriculture.
Location: Native to the Indian subcontinent, now grown in tropical and subtropical regions worldwide.
Medical_Usage: Used for its antibacterial, antifungal, and antiparasitic properties; also used in skincare products.

Name: Nelavembu
Description: Also known as Andrographis paniculata, it is a herbaceous plant used in traditional medicine for its potent medicinal properties.
Location: Native to South Asian countries, especially India and Sri Lanka.
Medical_Usage: Used for treating fever, infections, and as an immune booster.

Name: Nerale
Description: Also known as Indian blackberry or jamun, it is a tropical tree with edible fruit known for its medicinal properties.
Location: Native to the Indian subcontinent, found in tropical and subtropical regions.
Medical_Usage: Used for managing diabetes, improving digestion, and treating skin ailments.

Name: Nooni
Description: Also known as Noni or Morinda citrifolia, it is a small evergreen tree with a pungent fruit used in traditional medicine.
Location: Native to Southeast Asia and Australasia, cultivated in tropical regions worldwide.
Medical_Usage: Used for its anti-inflammatory, antioxidant, and immune-boosting properties.

Name: Onion
Description: A bulbous vegetable cultivated worldwide for its culinary uses and medicinal properties.
Location: Cultivated worldwide in temperate and tropical regions.
Medical_Usage: Used for its antibacterial, anti-inflammatory, and antioxidant properties.

Name: Padri
Description: A plant with medicinal properties used in traditional medicine.
Location: Native to tropical and subtropical regions.
Medical_Usage: Used for treating fever, digestive disorders, and respiratory ailments.

Name: Palak (Spinach)
Description: A leafy green vegetable known for its high nutritional value.
Location: Cultivated worldwide in temperate and tropical regions.
Medical_Usage: Rich in vitamins and minerals, used for improving digestion and as an antioxidant.

Name: Papaya
Description: A tropical fruit tree known for its sweet orange fruit and numerous medicinal properties.
Location: Native to tropical America, now grown in tropical and subtropical regions worldwide.
Medical_Usage: Used for digestive disorders, skin care, and as an anti-inflammatory.

Name: Parijatha
Description: Also known as Night-flowering Jasmine, it is a small tree with fragrant flowers used in traditional medicine.
Location: Native to South Asia and Southeast Asia, found in tropical and subtropical regions.
Medical_Usage: Used for treating coughs, arthritis, and skin diseases.

Name: Pea
Description: A leguminous plant grown for its edible seeds, known for their nutritional value.
Location: Cultivated worldwide in temperate and subtropical regions.
Medical_Usage: Rich in protein and fiber, used for improving digestion and overall health.

Name: Pepper
Description: A flowering vine cultivated for its fruit, which is dried and used as a spice and seasoning.
Location: Native to South India, cultivated in tropical regions worldwide.
Medical_Usage: Used for its digestive, antioxidant, and anti-inflammatory properties.

Name: Pomegranate
Description: A fruit-bearing shrub or small tree known for its edible seeds and medicinal properties.
Location: Native to the region from Iran to northern India, cultivated in tropical and subtropical regions worldwide.
Medical_Usage: Used for its antioxidant, anti-inflammatory, and heart health benefits.

Name: Pumpkin
Description: A large fruiting vine known for its edible flesh and seeds, used in culinary and medicinal applications.
Location: Native to North America, cultivated worldwide in temperate and tropical regions.
Medical_Usage: Used for its high vitamin content, as a digestive aid, and for its antioxidant properties.

Name: Radish
Description: A root vegetable known for its peppery flavor and nutritional value.
Location: Cultivated worldwide in temperate and subtropical regions.
Medical_Usage: Used for improving digestion, as a diuretic, and for its antioxidant properties.

Name: Rose
Description: A genus of flowering shrubs known for their fragrant flowers and medicinal uses.
Location: Native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere, cultivated worldwide.
Medical_Usage: Used for its anti-inflammatory, antioxidant, and skin care properties.

Name: Sampige
Description: Also known as Champak, it is a large evergreen tree with fragrant flowers used in traditional medicine.
Location: Native to South Asia and Southeast Asia, found in tropical and subtropical regions.
Medical_Usage: Used for treating fever, inflammation, and skin diseases.

Name: Sapota
Description: Also known as Sapodilla, it is a tropical fruit tree known for its sweet, brown fruit.
Location: Native to southern Mexico, Central America, and the Caribbean, now grown in tropical regions worldwide.
Medical_Usage: Used for its high vitamin content, as a digestive aid, and for treating inflammation.

Name: Seethaashoka
Description: A flowering tree with medicinal properties used in traditional medicine.
Location: Native to the Indian subcontinent, found in tropical and subtropical regions.
Medical_Usage: Used for treating menstrual disorders, digestive issues, and as an analgesic.

Name: Seethapala
Description: Also known as Custard Apple, it is a small deciduous tree with sweet, edible fruits.
Location: Native to the tropical Americas, now grown in tropical regions worldwide.
Medical_Usage: Used for its high vitamin content, as a digestive aid, and for treating infections.

Name: Spinach
Description: A leafy green vegetable known for its high nutritional value.
Location: Cultivated worldwide in temperate and tropical regions.
Medical_Usage: Rich in vitamins and minerals, used for improving digestion and as an antioxidant.

Name: Tamarind
Description: A tropical tree known for its edible fruit pulp, used in culinary and medicinal applications.
Location: Native to tropical Africa, now grown in tropical and subtropical regions worldwide.
Medical_Usage: Used for its digestive properties, as a laxative, and for treating fever.

Name: Taro
Description: A tropical plant grown for its edible corms and leaves, used in culinary dishes.
Location: Native to Southeast Asia, cultivated in tropical and subtropical regions worldwide.
Medical_Usage: Used for its high starch content, as a digestive aid, and for its anti-inflammatory properties.

Name: Tecoma
Description: A genus of flowering plants known for their bright yellow flowers and ornamental value.
Location: Native to the Americas, cultivated in tropical and subtropical regions worldwide.
Medical_Usage: Used for treating diabetes, digestive disorders, and respiratory ailments.

Name: Thumbe
Description: A herbaceous plant used in traditional medicine for its medicinal properties.
Location: Native to tropical and subtropical regions, commonly found in gardens and cultivated areas.
Medical_Usage: Used for treating digestive disorders, fever, and skin diseases.

Name: Tomato
Description: A widely cultivated fruiting plant known for its edible fruits used in culinary dishes.
Location: Native to South America, now grown worldwide in temperate and tropical regions.
Medical_Usage: Rich in vitamins and antioxidants, used for improving digestion and heart health.

Name: Tulsi
Description: Also known as Holy Basil, it is a sacred plant in Hinduism with numerous medicinal properties.
Location: Native to the Indian subcontinent, cultivated in tropical and subtropical regions.
Medical_Usage: Used for its anti-inflammatory, antimicrobial, and stress-relieving properties.

Name: Turmeric
Description: A flowering plant whose rhizomes are used as a spice and in traditional medicine.
Location: Native to South Asia, cultivated in tropical and subtropical regions worldwide.
Medical_Usage: Used for its anti-inflammatory, antioxidant, and antimicrobial properties.

Name: Ashoka
Description: A small evergreen tree with fragrant flowers, used in traditional medicine.
Location: Native to the Indian subcontinent, found in tropical and subtropical regions.
Medical_Usage: Used for treating menstrual disorders, uterine ailments, and as an analgesic.

Name: Vetiver
Description: A perennial grass known for its aromatic roots, used in traditional medicine and perfumery.
Location: Native to India, cultivated in tropical and subtropical regions worldwide.
Medical_Usage: Used for treating anxiety, insomnia, and as an antiseptic.

Name: Vinca
Description: A genus of flowering plants commonly known as periwinkle, used for its medicinal properties.
Location: Native to Europe, Northwest Africa, and Southwest Asia, cultivated in temperate and tropical regions.
Medical_Usage: Used for treating diabetes, high blood pressure, and cancer.

Name: Winter Cherry
Description: Also known as Ashwagandha, it is a small shrub with medicinal properties used in traditional medicine.
Location: Native to India, North Africa, and the Middle East.
Medical_Usage: Used for its adaptogenic properties, treating stress, anxiety, and improving vitality.

Name: Zinnia
Description: A genus of flowering plants known for their bright, colorful flowers, used in ornamental gardening and traditional medicine.
Location: Native to North and South America, cultivated worldwide in gardens and as decorative plants.
Medical_Usage: Used for treating skin diseases and as an anti-inflammatory.
